text: The Union of Sweden and Norway (; ), officially the United Kingdoms of Sweden and Norway, was a personal union. It consisted of the separate kingdoms of Sweden and Norway under the same monarch. It lasted from 1814 to 1905. In 1905 Sweden accepted Norway leaving the union. Both states kept their separate constitutions, laws, legislatures, administrations, state churches, armed forces, and currencies. However the kings mostly resided in Stockholm. Stockholm was also the town where foreign diplomatic representations were located. ==References== Category:19th century in Sweden Category:History of Norway Category:1814 establishments Category:1900s disestablishments in Europe Category:1810s establishments in Europe
title: Union between Sweden and Norway
